description._content: Photograph of James Fairbairn, one of a group of photos of the Deseronto branch of the Sons of Scotland. A notice in The Tribune of November 27, 1903, states that the group met on the second Thursday of each month in the Masonic Building (the Clement Block). Fairbairn was a photographer and also, for a time, the postmaster of Deseronto. In the 1901 census his date of birth was given as 18 June 1866 in rural Ontario, with Scottish ancestry. His wife, Lizzie was born in the United States on 12 Apr 1868. She came to Canada in 1881. Living with them were their daughter, Evelyn (b. 29 July 1891) and their son Robbie (b. 11 Mar 1893), who were both born in urban Ontario. Fairbairn's earnings are given as $400.
